subject: OT: XPath sum(node-set nodes) function Question
msgSnippet: Does any one know of a similar XML XSL XPath forum? I have found very few examples of XPath sum() usage (at least not enough). I have an XML file that
messageBody:
Does any one know of a similar XML XSL XPath forum?

I have found very few examples of XPath sum() usage (at least not enough).
I have an XML file that references an XSL file for formatting. It is
working.

However, I want to add some group level summation.

The XML file is fairly flat in structure.

My question: Does XPath sum() work with relatively flat XML data trees or
must they have more levels to represent the grouping levels?

The XSL template file contains three nested <xsl:for-each ...> loops.
The first loop sorts/groups on <key1>, the second on <key1>-<Key2> and the
third loop on <text1> displaying the corresponding values for <count>.

Existing (flat) XML data tree:
<root>

<record>
<key1>A</key1>
<key2>1</key2>
<text1>text</text1>
<count>2</count>
</record>

</root>

Alternative grouping level XML data tree:
<root>

<record>
<key1>A
<key2>1
<text1>text
<count>1</count>
</text1>
</key2>
</key1>
</record>

</root>

Is trying to sum() with the 'flat' XML file futile?
Or should I spend my efforts to create the alternative XML file?

Suggestions will be appreciated.

Clark Anderson
